meanings.definition: To surpass in volume or intensity in speaking or singing.
meanings.sent1: During the play, Sarah tried to outvoice the other actors to be heard clearly.
meanings.sent2: She always outvoices her friends when they sing together.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom playfully attempted to outvoice the music to tell a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her passion outvoicing her fear, she spoke up against the injustice.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outvoicing all other sounds, echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To speak or sing louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: When excited, the children tend to outvoice each other in their conversations.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outvoice his siblings during family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The birds outvoicing each other in the morning created a beautiful symphony.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outvoicing the noise of the party, caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The cheers of the fans outvoicing the referee's whistle filled the stadium.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking or singing louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outvoicing of the group discussion made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent2: The outvoicing in the choir practice led to a harmonious performance.
meanings.sent3: The outvoicing of the auctioneer amused the bidders as he tried to sell a small item.
meanings.sent4: His outvoicing of the crowd's noise showed his determination to be heard.
meanings.sent5: The outvoicing of the waves crashing against the shore drowned out all other sounds.
